# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = []
    current_line = ""
    for word in split(text)
        if length(current_line) + length(word) <= text_width
            # Append the word to the current line
            current_line *= word * ' '
        else
            # Exceeds the width, so start a new line
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = ""
            current_line *= word * ' '
        end
    end
    if current_line != ""
        push!(lines, current_line)
    end
    return join(lines, '\n')
end
```

Example usage:

```julia
julia> wrap_string("Hello there this is a very long sentence that should be wrapped to fit within the text width.")
"Hello there\nthis is a very long\nsentence that should be wrapped\nto fit within the text width."
```
